metadata.synopsis: Dialog file for Ptaris, the Gith born from the egg given to Esther. The player enters on a scene of devestation, Ptaris the only being still alive. Hatched unnaturally from his egg and experimented on in the name of making him 'good', he has developed uncanny psionic powers, and used them to murder everyone who failed to live up to his strict moral code.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- Use the portal |Gith Kid Portal| - S_LOW_TheLodge_GithKidArena_PortalDown a22a7d3a-24d7-4f97-a142-75dd623d04ad - (-214; 20; -88)- The dialog will be started when the kid spots you

30.speaker: Ptaris
30.text: You - you don't look like them. You look like me. Who are you?
30.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player emerges from the strange portal. They see Ptaris stood at the end of the wooden pier projecting out into the basement. He stands with his back to the player, perfectly still. At his feet is the body of Esther the expeditioner. As he speaks he turns to face the player.

Esther the expeditioner: S_GLO_Expeditioner_5f4048ba-72ef-43c2-9528-1c9a12f3f82f

125.speaker: Player
125.text: You've never seen another githyanki before?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Do not demand answers of me, yank. Tell me what happened here.

52.speaker: Ptaris
52.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player emerges from the strange portal. They see Ptaris stood at the end of the wooden pier projecting out into the basement. He stands with his back to the player, perfectly still. At his feet is the body of Esther the expeditioner. As he speaks he turns to face the player.

Esther the expeditioner: S_GLO_Expeditioner_5f4048ba-72ef-43c2-9528-1c9a12f3f82f

85.speaker: Ptaris
85.text: Who are you? Another who needs to learn the difference between right and wrong?
85.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player emerges from the strange portal. They see Ptaris stood at the end of the wooden pier projecting out into the basement. He stands with his back to the player, perfectly still. At his feet is the body of Esther the expeditioner. As he speaks he turns to face the player.

Esther the expeditioner: S_GLO_Expeditioner_5f4048ba-72ef-43c2-9528-1c9a12f3f82f

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *A githyanki youth, and a familiar one at that. Can it be that this is the one who hatched from the egg you took from the crèche?*
121.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

70.speaker: Player
70.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

114.speaker: Ptaris
114.text: It is my home, of course. Father raised me here. Taught me. Made me grow.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: It's nice to see you again, githyanki.
41.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

106.speaker: Ptaris
106.text: I am not a githyanki. Do not call me that!
106.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

28.speaker: Ptaris
28.text: I am Ptaris. And I am good.
28.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

44.speaker: Ptaris
44.text: Father was bad. They all were. I tried to make them better, but they were not strong enough. They lacked resolve.
44.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

56.speaker: Player
56.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

12.speaker: Ptaris
12.text: Havkelaag. He brought me from the shell. Raised me quickly. Taught me to be good. But he failed me.
12.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

34.speaker: Ptaris
34.text: He was not righteous. He was not innocent. His thoughts were impure.
34.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

33.speaker: Ptaris
33.text: Such evil can only be cured one way. With pain. With torment. And if that does not work - with death.
33.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

95.speaker: Ptaris
95.text: Tell me - are you a good person?
95.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

104.speaker: Player
104.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

23.speaker: Ptaris
23.text: If you only think, then you do not know.
23.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

26.speaker: Ptaris
26.text: The Ptarian Code must be obeyed. This is the only way to be sure. Do you follow it?
26.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

25.speaker: Player
25.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

45.speaker: Ptaris
45.text: It is honour. Justice. The true form of goodness we all must live by, decreed by Bahamut himself.
45.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

11.speaker: Ptaris
11.text: You are not capable of following its teachings.
11.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

105.speaker: Ptaris
105.text: I know what you did to me. I see the memory of it, right there in your head.
105.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

2.speaker: Ptaris
2.text: You stole me from my people. Gave me to that woman. Unhatched, defenceless. You let me be brought here so father could hurt me.
2.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

55.speaker: Player
55.text: A githyanki raised in isolation. His blood boils like his kin's, but their ways are foreign.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

130.speaker: Lae'zel
130.text: A githyanki raised in isolation. His blood boils like his kin's, but their ways are foreign.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: A githyanki raised in isolation. His blood boils like Vlaakith's, but he knows nothing of the Protocols.
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You are bad. You must be taught a lesson.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

132.speaker: Ptaris
132.text: You are bad. You must be taught a lesson.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You feel strange, don't you? That's your conscience. It's telling you to stop.
21.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

141.speaker: Ptaris
141.text: Father said I lacked a conscience. He said I was a nasty, evil thing, but he could make me good. He cured me.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I thought I was saving you. I had no idea what they were planning.
15.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I never should have saved you. But I'm happy to rectify my mistake.
123.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You would have been destroyed if not for me. I saved you.
48.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

80.speaker: Ptaris
80.text: You were trying to save me? I - I don't understand.

128.speaker: Ptaris
128.text: You were trying to save me? I - I don't understand.

99.text: Evil can never save good. But good can cure evil. I will save you yet.

66.speaker: Ptaris
66.text: Evil can never save good. But good can cure evil. I will save you yet.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I wield my anger like a blade, but it does not rule me. I am no more 'bad' than you are.
78.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

137.speaker: Ptaris
137.text: You mean anger is not always bad? But - but that's not what father said.
137.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

49.speaker: Ptaris
49.text: You mean anger is not always bad? But - but that's not what father said.
49.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

61.speaker: Ptaris
61.text: Father saved me. I was a nasty, evil thing, but his treatments made me good. I - I'm cured.
61.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

8.speaker: Player
8.text: He lied to you. No one is born evil.

57.speaker: Ptaris
57.text: But - but why would he hurt me if I didn't need to be cured?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Good people offer forgiveness to those who sin. Not death.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Cured? You still look like a githyanki to me.

17.speaker: Ptaris
17.text: I could not change that, even if I wanted to.

27.speaker: Ptaris
27.text: I - I killed him. I killed all these people. I am no better than any of them.

65.speaker: Ptaris
65.text: The code is flawed. And I am a monster, as he said I was. I cannot be trusted.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: He is lost. A shame - he could have proved a great ally to Orpheus.

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: He is lost. A shame - he could have proved a great ally to Orpheus.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: His mind is forever lost. Come - he is no use to us, nor my queen.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: You were cured of nothing. Only a true githyanki would destroy their enemy so thoroughly.

109.speaker: Ptaris
109.text: No - that's not why I did it. He was bad. I - I thought he deserved it.

112.text: Lies. Only death can save you now.

24.speaker: Ptaris
24.text: Lies. Only death can save you now.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Ungrateful yank. Our kin would have destroyed you if it wasn't for me.
63.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

60.speaker: Player
60.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

136.speaker: Ptaris
136.text: I did the right thing. I followed the code. He deserved it. They all deserved it!
136.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

0.speaker: Ptaris
0.text: I did the right thing. I followed the code. He deserved it. They all deserved it!

46.speaker: Ptaris
46.text: I should feel better now. Why don't I feel better?

75.text: No! No! Do not touch my thoughts. They are good. I am GOOD!
75.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

127.speaker: Ptaris
127.text: No! No! Do not touch my thoughts. They are good. I am GOOD!
127.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I gave you what my patron gave me - a chance at something more.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy puts both palms to his head, as though in distress.

146.speaker: Player
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy puts both palms to his head, as though in distress.

117.speaker: Ptaris
117.text: I will cleanse the evil from you. Your nature can be changed. I -
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy puts both palms to his head, as though in distress.

144.speaker: Ptaris
144.text: Your mind. Evil writhes within it. You cannot be cured. You must be destroyed.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I follow my gut. That's all anyone can do.

35.speaker: Ptaris
35.text: Your gut cannot be trusted. That is why the code exists. That is why you failed.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I live by my own code, though not the one you speak of.

37.speaker: Ptaris
37.text: Then your code is flawed. Your actions cannot be defended.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: No one code can define goodness. It's impossible.

120.speaker: Ptaris
120.text: Only a bad person would say that. And that's what you are.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: The Ptarian code? Then you follow the teachings of Bahamut?

83.speaker: Ptaris
83.text: The purest of your rulers. But you are nothing like him. You are tainted.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: The code of Bahamut. His guidance leads me in all things.

143.speaker: Ptaris
143.text: Do you really believe that? You are unfit to say his name.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I know of it. All such codes require self-discipline. In all such codes, murder is a violation.

119.speaker: Ptaris
119.text: Yet you have killed, many times. It is engraved on your memories. You are a hypocrite.

145.speaker: Ptaris
145.text: There is only one way. The Ptarian code. Do you follow it?

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I'm good at being bad. Does that count?

51.speaker: Ptaris
51.text: You cannot be both good and bad. It is impossible. There is no goodness in you.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I've tried to be, though I've failed often enough.

19.speaker: Ptaris
19.text: Then perhaps I am one of your failures.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Right and wrong don't matter so long as you get the job done.

6.speaker: Ptaris
6.text: I see. You have abandoned goodness. Like you abandoned me.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I try to be, but sometimes my magic has other ideas.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I try to be. For I serve a greater power - one who embodies everything good in this world.

59.speaker: Ptaris
59.text: There is no 'try'. You are either good or you are not.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Please - there is no 'good'. There is only the power one wields over others.

79.speaker: Ptaris
79.text: So that is why you did it.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I try not to look at things as good or evil. Life is a mixture of both.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I fight, eat, drink, love, and hate with everything I have - that is all that matters.

5.speaker: Ptaris
5.text: Such an empty and  meaningless life.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: We're not having this conversation. If you massacred those people, you must pay the price.

13.speaker: Ptaris
13.text: You would speak of punishment to me?

47.speaker: Ptaris
47.text: I see it. Your head is filled with evil. There is no goodness there.

1.speaker: Ptaris
1.text: You are unfit to live. I will see that you are expunged.

62.speaker: Player
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ptaris looks down, as though only just remembering Esther lies dead at his feet.NodeContext: Indifferent to the dead body at his feet.

88.speaker: Ptaris
88.text: She did not have the strength to be good. She was another like father - lacking in moral fibre.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ptaris looks down, as though only just remembering Esther lies dead at his feet.NodeContext: Indifferent to the dead body at his feet.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: What did they do that was so terrible?

110.speaker: Ptaris
110.text: They did not live up to father's code. Even he did not follow it correctly.

89.speaker: Ptaris
89.text: It is not my fault they died. I was only upholding father's code. Even he was not strong enough to follow it.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Don't worry - I'm not here to judge.

142.speaker: Ptaris
142.text: Everyone judges, and everyone must be judged. This is the only way to know if we are good enough. Father was not.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: A githyanki? What are you doing down here?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: My oath helps me decide right from wrong - I need no teaching.

138.speaker: Ptaris
138.text: No. Everyone must learn. Right from wrong. Good from bad.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I do not seek right or wrong. I seek balance.

111.speaker: Ptaris
111.text: No. You have to know right from wrong. Good from bad.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Are you responsible for that massacre I just walked through?

124.speaker: Ptaris
124.text: Perhaps it is easier to be good when you are alone.
